meanings.definition: Related to or characteristic of competition or conflict
meanings.sent1: The two teams had an agonistic match to determine the winner.
meanings.sent2: In sports, players often display agonistic behavior when striving to win.
meanings.sent3: The siblings had an agonistic race to see who could finish their chores first.
meanings.sent4: The market was an agonistic battlefield with companies fighting for customers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used an agonistic approach to motivate students to excel.

meanings.definition: A person who is competitive or combative in nature
meanings.sent1: She was known as an agonistic in the office due to her fierce determination.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was a true agonistic, always seeking out challenging opponents.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's playful nature made him an agonistic in hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The politician was an agonistic, always ready to debate and defend his views.
meanings.sent5: The warrior was respected for his agonistic spirit in battle.
